context: Võin is the first person singular present tense form of the modal verb 'võima' in Estonian, which means 'to be able to' or 'to have permission to'. It's commonly used to express ability, possibility, or permission. The negative form is 'ei või' (cannot/may not), and other forms include 'saad' (you can), 'ta saab' (he/she can), etc.
